item.title: Hezbollah fires 200 rockets and drones into Israel
item.description: Hezbollah launched the barrage in response to Israel's killing of one of its senior commanders.

item.title: Hezbollah fires over 200 rockets into Israel after killing of senior commander - The Associated Press
item.description:
1. Hezbollah fires over 200 rockets into Israel after killing of senior commander  The Associated Press
  2. Hezbollah fires more than 200 missiles at Israeli targets following killing of commander  CNN
  3. IDF announces fallen soldier Major (Res.) Itay Galea on Lebanon border  The Jerusalem Post
  4. What to Know as Israel-Hezbollah Conflict Grows  The New York Times
  5. Hezbollah fires 200 rockets, launches 20 drones in major attack on north  The Times of Israel

item.title: What we learned from Count Binface, challenger to Rishi Sunak
Hezbollah says it has fired 200 rockets into Israel after killing of commander
item.description:
Barrage from Lebanon one of group’s largest yet, as Israel discusses Hamas proposals for possible Gaza ceasefire

Lebanon’s Hezbollah said it had fired 200 rockets into Israel on Thursday in one of its largest barrages yet, as Benjamin Netanyahu said his Israeli government was discussing proposals from Hamas about a possible ceasefire deal in Gaza.

Israel confirmed the Iran-backed militant group had fired “numerous projectiles and suspicious aerial targets” from Lebanon towards the occupied Syrian Golan Heights and more than 15 drones into Israeli territory, many of which it said were intercepted. An Israeli military spokesperson said there were no casualties reported.

Continue reading...
